name: Addressing Urban Heat in Bengaluru : Data Jam
description:
Inviting registrations for Datajam! Registration form 

This datajam is organized by OpenCity.in in collaboration with Bengaluru Climate Action Cell and WRI India, with support from ATREE, Oorvani Foundation & Citizen Matters.

At the datajam,  participants collaborate to scrape, clean, use open data to analyse different aspects of climate change – risks, vulnerabilities and state of mitigations – in Bengaluru and recommend solutions.
All output/findings will be shared on OpenCity.in and CitizenMatters and available for republication under a cc license. 
Who can participate:
Anyone with an interest in public problem solving is welcome. Knowledge of data analysis, visualisation, GIS and/or coding would be helpful.

Expectations from Participants:
Use publicly available data to analyze data related to urban heat – temperature, demographics, infrastructure – in Bengaluru. Also use existing knowledge and understanding of the city to look for challenges and suggest improvements to mitigate the challenges. 
Public data is not restricted to what is available on OpenCity. You can find and use any data that is available publicly or can be made public. 
Note: Data that is behind paywalls, or under Non-Disclosure Agreements cannot be used.

name: Fixing waste journeys : Active citizen workshop
description:
Together, uncover the journey of waste and brainstorm solutions, which could be featured on Citizen Matters and shared with concerned officials! 
Registration link: 
Learning session: Friday August 9th, 6 pm– 8:30 pm (Zoom link to be provided)

Facilitators: Pinky Chandran, Independent Researcher, Less Waste Practitioner @swmrtbengaluru @wasteframes; Meera K is Founder and Trustee, Oorvani Foundation.




Expectation: You need to be familiar with waste management, and preferably have some volunteering experience. Open to participants from any city. 
The session will have groups working on specific site use cases – you will also be documenting findings/observations, with short videos or photos
For any queries, mail  foundation@oorvani.in 

Oorvani Foundation is a non-profit committed to civic engagement, citizenship and communities.
